November 12, 1829 from Edgar Allan Poe, Baltimore, to John Allan Manuscript, Valentine Museum, Richmond, Virginia
I wrote you about a fortnight ago and as I have not heard from you, I was fear'd you had forgotten me -

I would not trouble you so often if I was not extremely pinched — I am almost without clothes — and, as I board by the month, the lady with whom I board is anxious for my money -I have not had any (you know) since the middle of August — I hope the letter I wrote last was received in which you will see that I have cleared myself from any censure of neglect as regards W.P. —
Hoping that you will not forget to write as soon as you receive this
I am Dear Pa Yours affectionately Edgar A. Poe
